item.title: Partyroom command
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote=“powerscape, post:3, topic:376450”]a party room command for admin who then say: openparyroom and players do: party room than they enter the party room[/quote]So, if an administrator types: ::closepartyroom then no one can enter? But if an administrator types: ::openpartyroom then they can enter? Okay, then you’d do something similar to this:

I’ve edited this post TWICE. So before posting an error, please look over the post again. I was in a hurry making this post, and I re-read it and saw a mistake or two.

First you need to declare a flag that makes the party room either open or closed (true or false):

Put this in your Entity class (or client.java)

private boolean isPartyRoomOpen = false;

Now you need to make a method that sets that flag to true or false:

public void setPartyRoomOpen(boolean b) {
    isPartyRoomOpen = b;
}

Now you just need a simple method that returns the flag:

public boolean getPartyRoomStatus() {
    return isPartyRoomOpen;
}

Now in your command packet handler you need to make a new command:

if(command.startsWith("openroom")) {
    setPartyRoomOpen(true);
} else if(command.startsWith("closeroom")) {
    setPartyRoomOpen(false);
}

Now all you need to go is make the goto command (add under previous statements):

else if(command.startsWith("gotoroom") && (getPartyRoomStatus() == true)) {
// to-do code
}

Read full topic
